original: Bergum, Nils Börje, redaktör, Göteborg, f. 17/2/04 i Hälsingborg. — Stud:ex. v. Hälsingb. h. a. 1. 22. Stud. v. Lunds univ. Res. ^t. Danm. o. Tyskl. 32, Finl. 34, Hoill. 36, Norge 37. Med- ar b. i Göiteborgs-Posten sed. 28. Led. av Kulturhiist. fören. f. s. Sv:e, Samf. f. hembygdsvård, Simfrämj. m. m. Medl. av PuW o. Sv. journ:fören. Särintresse: musik. Hobbies’: simning, tennrs, litterär Mippsaml.
translated: Bergum, Nils Börje, editor, Gothenburg, b. February 17, 1904 in Helsingborg. – Passed graduation exam in the spring at Hälsingborg high school in 1922. Studied at Lund University and traveled to Denmark and Germany in 1932, Finland in 1934, Holland in 1936, and Norway in 1937. He has been an associate editor of the Gothenburg Post since 1928 and is a member of the Swedish Society for Cultural History, the Society for Local Heritage, the Society for Swimming Promotion, and more. He is also a member of the Public Workers' Union and Swedish Journalist Association. His special interest is music and his hobbies include swimming, tennis and collecting literary souvenirs. He married in the year not specified.
